items.title: JSAUX All-in-One Switch 2 Carrying Case is bigger and costs 65% less than Nintendo’s at $29 all-time low
items.summary:
JSAUX All-in-One large carrying case for Nintendo Switch 2

Buy for $29 (Reg. $46)

What we love

If you want something protective to carry your entire Switch 2 setup, JSAUX’s all-in-one case is a great pick. It fits the console, controllers, dock, cables, power bank, and up to 10 games, all neatly organized. You also get EVA padding, a hard water-resistant shell, and a handle plus shoulder strap for easy travel. It can be a lot better than other carrying cases if you need to carry more than just your console and a few games.

items.title: Wild deal gets you Anker’s display-equipped 25K power bank w/ a FREE $90 140W 4-port laptop charger (50% off)
items.summary:
We just spotted a solid deal at Walmart that bundles Anker’s Prime 140W 4-port charger with a 25,000mAh 165W power bank for $104.99 shipped. That’s a ridiculously low price, considering the power bank itself is currently going for $105 on Amazon right now as part of a Valentine’s Day sale. The 140W charger typically goes for $90, so you’re essentially getting $210 worth of gear for half the price. It’s a great value if you’re looking to upgrade your setup for both home and travel charging. We don’t expect this deal to last long, so it’s worth grabbing while it’s still available.

items.title: U Mobile Rolls Out ULTRA5G Network To Major Transport Hubs
items.summary:
U Mobile has continued to expand its ULTRA5G network to more locations with the support of EDOTCO, its digital infrastructure partner. The deployment follows previous expansions in populated areas. This time, the telco has enabled 5G in-building coverage (IBC) at the country’s major transportation hubs, including key airports. This rollout forms part of the network […]

The post U Mobile Rolls Out ULTRA5G Network To Major Transport Hubs appeared first on Lowyat.NET.

items.title: Apple’s Ambitious Siri Upgrade Reportedly Hits Testing Snag
items.summary:
Apple’s highly anticipated overhaul of Siri has encountered new problems during internal testing, potentially delaying several headline features beyond their previously targeted release window. According to Bloomberg, citing people familiar with the matter, recent test builds revealed reliability and performance issues that may force Apple to stagger the rollout across multiple software updates. As reported […]

The post Apple’s Ambitious Siri Upgrade Reportedly Hits Testing Snag appeared first on Lowyat.NET.

items.title: Anna's Archive has quietly begun releasing millions of music files from its scrape of Spotify, despite an injunction against distribution of copyrighted works (Ernesto Van der Sar/TorrentFreak)
items.summary:
Ernesto Van der Sar / TorrentFreak:
Anna's Archive has quietly begun releasing millions of music files from its scrape of Spotify, despite an injunction against distribution of copyrighted works  —  Anna's Archive is generally known as a meta-search engine for shadow libraries, helping users find pirated books and other related resources.

items.title: Score $1,500 savings during NIU’s Valentine’s Day Sale on the BQi-C3 Pro or BQi Fat Tire 300 e-bikes at lows from $899
items.summary:
As part of its ongoing Valentine’s Day Sale, and coming alongside our earlier coverage of the up to $700 e-scooter savings, we wanted to shine a spotlight on the e-bike section of offers. One notable return is the brand’s BQi-C3 Pro Commuter e-bike at $999 shipped, which comes in gray, black, or white colorways, and is dropping down from its $2,499 MSRP here. Over the last year we regularly saw discounts taking the costs down between $1,500 and $1,299, with occasional falls lower, though since Black Friday we’re seeing more regular returns to the $999 low. During this sale, you’re getting another shot at the lowest price we have tracked, giving you a highly capable commuter with $1,500 savings. Head below to browse the full lineup of deals while they’re still around.

items.title: Save up to 51% on Hiboy EVs, like the S2 Max e-scooter with up to a 40-mile range at $495 (Reg. $650), more from $300
items.summary:
Hiboy has an ongoing Valentine’s Day Sale that is seeing up to 51% discounts on its e-scooters and e-bikes (and an extra 5% savings on orders with any two of the models listed below), as well as 25% accessory discounts. One of the more affordable means to commute longer distances during this event is the Hiboy S2 Max Electric Scooter down at $494.99 shipped, which also matches in price at Amazon. While it may carry a $835 MSRP direct from the brand, you can more often find it regularly at $650, with discounts over the past year having gone as low as $490. Jumping on this deal gives you the second-best price of the last year, courtesy of the $155 markdown off the going rate (and $340 off the MSRP), landing it just $25 above the all-time low last seen in 2024. As cheaper alternatives in this series, you can also find the 25-mile trekking S2 Pro e-scooter at $423 (and matching at Amazon), while the entry-level S2 e-scooter with a 17-mile range is down at $300 (also matching at Amazon). You’ll find the brand’s eligible offers of alternate EVs collected for you below.
